reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ragdoll so much you will think your playing the insurance fraud side mission in saints row 4, but you wont get any bonus for the ragdoll...

Im not sure if I can recommend this game or not. Its a great concept and is kind of fun, but leads to be boring after a short time. It can be funny and make you laugh but it can also just drag. After only 1.5 hours of playtime I am not sure I will play again until the next update. My 4 year old even got bored of it after a while. While I can certainly appreciate the open world sandbox experience, it doesnt feel like it is fully there as of yet. I'm certain there are things outside of the city to find, however its a drag if you flip your car upsidedown and are stuck out there trying to search on foot - you end up spending a very long time just walking back to find another car or even just walking to -- nowhere really. It feels empty and barron outside the city walls and there doesnt seem like there is really much to do inside the city either (except for fall down over and over).

The mechanics feel clunky as well which is another thing that was really aggrivating to me. Walk up a curb fall down, walk to a wall fall down, walk to a door fall down, walk to a car door - fall down, even walking to an object results in getting knocked to the ground. I'm not sure if this is how the physics are supposed to work or not at this point and being I never played the previous version I dont know much about the game, but constant ragdoll when trying to walk to a object or even a NPC is very annoying to me.

I saw a bunch of stuff in the videos and update news but cant seem to find them in game. Rocket Launcher?? Where is it? Fly a blimp, uh how and where?? Just thinking that the game is not very intuitive on letting players know where things are at, I mean I know there are things to find outside the walls of the city, but who wants to drive for 10 minutes somewhere, flip the car upside down then have to walk for 20 minutes though empty fields to find a freakin boat because there is no way to flip the car back upright??

Also the game needs some background music, all you hear outside of radios in the area is the frogs feet slapping against the ground as you walk. While I give it a +1 for creative thinking there some ambient music would be nice - the silent slapping of the frogs feet I feel contributes to making it feel more bland.

All in all the experience so far is OK, not great/amazing and not totally awful. I am going to recommend this game to sucker more people that skim over this review into buying the game so that maybe they will give some ideas in the forum and help make the game better.

*Funny character
*Large world
*Great for kids (until they get bored too)
*Developers are very active in the community
*Sharks
*A frog with a gun that can drive cars!!
*Local coop is fun

Cons:
*Lots of space without much to do
*Clunky physics result in falling down alot
*Not very intuitive - at least give me a hint on where I can go to find things to do
*Wheres all the stuff from the videos??
*Needs a music option
*Lots of graphical glitches

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game speaks to me on an emotional level. Many twists and turns, with a fabulous story, excellent customization, and ecstatic gameplay. I will now go through the 3 main things that make the game so special to me.

1. Charecter Customization

This game features such detailed customization you couldn't tell the difference between me and my frog. Size, Hair color, arm length, toe curliness, hair waviness, neck density, favored cheese, and elbow pointiness are only a few features of this game. The charecter looks so much like me, my girlfriend started making out with the computer monitor, thinking it was me. And by girlfriend, I mean a digital copy of Amazing Frog?.

2. Story

I was reduced to tears by this game's enthralling story. It stars your frog, and his society of jugglers, Pablo, Keiran, Akbar, and Gustavo. Your frog has cancer and must tap dance his way to the top of the leaderboards, to be noticed by the great Hi-Lo, the esteemed drug lord, who also happened to be a giant Cheeze-It. On the way you meet Elga The Annihilator, your charecter's love interest, Gorf, your evil twin, and Gandalf, a wizard. With thousands of side missions and optional quests, the game never seems to have an end.

3. Gameplay

Amazing Frog has an amazing array of tricks up its sleeve, with things like a full skill tree, amazing 4K graphics, full Oculus Rift support, full Smell-a-vision support, the abilty to make you fly, and the power of friendship. This game runs esseptionally well on my Google Glasses.

I would rank this game as followed:

Amazing Frog? > My life's values > My Firstborn > My Welfare > All Social Contact > Eating > Sunlight > 10

Glitchy, this is not that bad, due to it not only being in early access, and that there are only a handful, which should get fixed eventually.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As someone who has played countless hours of this game on Ouya, I'm SUPER excited this is finally on Steam!

Amazing Frog is a quirky-physics sandbox game. The amount of enjoyment you will get out of it will depend a lot on how much you can provide your own entertainment. There are trampolines, vehicles, cannons, trampolines, ramps, and other objects strewn throughout the world. It's a playground of items with near-limitless potential.

In the transition from Ouya they've made the world MUCH larger and removed the odd pricing scheme for level access, opting for a flat rate. I think $15 is more than fair for the amount of time you'll get out of this discovering items, screwing around with friends, and having a good time. The game doesn't bring much to the table if you're playing alone; playing with at least one other person is best.

My few disappointments are the lack of availability for weapons (there were many more readily available in the Ouya version), and that the game no longer appears to outline where the other players are on the map. On the Ouya version you would see an outline of the other players wherever they were on the map. The settings menu is SLIGHTLY confusing because when you choose Fantastic" for graphics it appears to accept but reflects "Fast" in the menu anyway. I'd chalk that up to a glitch.

All-told
date: it's GREAT fun for local co-op and I'd recommend it to anyone that wants to have a great couple hours with friends just messing around."

Early Access Review

Should you buy this game?
HELL. YES.

I seldom buy games in the same manner I bought this one, out of sheer curiosity and intrigue, and to be perfectly honest a part of me was certain I'd regret acquiring it, but boy was I wrong. 'Amazing Frog?' has been keeping me entertained for far more time than any AAA title has managed to entertain in a VERY long time.

So what makes it so special?
This is one of the most unique videogames I've ever had the pleasure of playing, not because it has jaw-dropping visuals, or a deep plot, or interesting characters. None of that. This masterpiece DOES NOT need those, because, as it stands, it is already a better title than numerous other games that decided to invest in those departments. Why? Because it's just FUN. The silliness of its mechanics, how ridiculous it is (I mean frogs with RPGs!), how much promise it shows... If there are indie titles out there worth buying this is definitely one of them.

Without a doubt one of the best acquisitions I've ever made, and I can barely what for what the next update brings!

Early Access Review

Ok, so I bought this game to play with my friends. It was really good. I enjoyed it... There are still a few flaws though.
Personally, if you're into GTA, Goat Simulator, Gang Beasts, and other Funny Physics based games I recommend giving this one a try. Amazing Frog is great, and I'm hoping the game gets better as it receives updates. I don't have much time to write a full review, so I'll write the pros and cons for now.

Pros:
- Its really entertaining at first, especially if you/your friends didn't expect your frog to fart alot.
- The PvP is ridiculous. My brother and I really liked it.
- Finding new things is great, especially the Vault.
- You can mix and match costumes for your frog.
- Many Collectibles ranging from Kitties, TVs, Microscopes, Trophies, and costumes.
- Great to play in short bursts and long 100+ minute sessions.
- More features are coming soon, so I could expect that this game will get better.

Cons:
- For some reason, the Mouse input likes to stutter alot in certain rooms.
- A bit laggy. I'm complaining because this game does not really have the graphics of Wolfenstein: The Old Blood and the huge content filled world of GTAV. I expect something better from something so barren. I can understand the multiplayer lagging though.
- It was a little easy (for me) to get the OUYA version mixed with the PC version. Its not bad, but I was hoping for the Party mode.
